intro: Donatia novae-zelandiae, commonly known as the New Zealand donatia, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, showy flowers that are typically white or pink in color. It grows as an upright shrub, often found in forest understories. Its foliage is simple and opposite, with elliptical leaves that have a slightly serrated edge.
